alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cattaraugus and southeastern Chautauqua Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Falconer, or 11 miles northeast of Jamestown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Olean, Salamanca, Allegany State Park, Falconer, Ashford, Arcade, Allegany, Franklinville, St. Bonaventure, Ashford Hollow, Weston Mills, Frewsburg, Yorkshire, Hinsdale, Great Valley, New Albion, Conewango, Ellington, Leon and Carrollton. This includes Interstate 86 between exits 13 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for western New York.
